generif.text: results strongly suggest that HURP is a potential novel cell cycle regulator that may play a role in the carcinogenesis of human cancer cells
Cdk1-cyclin B-phosphorylated hepatoma up-regulated protein (HURP) proteolysis is regulated by Fbx7 and the SCF complex
KIAA0008 expression is associated with invasiveness of HCC; overexpression of KIAA0008 leads to a more invasive phenotype of HCC cell lines.
HURP is a potential oncogenic target of Aurora-A.

HURP controls spindle stability and dynamics to achieve efficient kinetochore capture at prometaphase, timely chromosome congression to the metaphase plate, and proper interkinetochore tension for anaphase initiation.
Dlg7 has a role in stem cell survival, in maintaining stem cell properties, and in carcinogenesis.
Phosphorylation of HURP by Aurora A provides a regulatory mechanism for the control of spindle assembly and function.
Combined expression of DLG7 and PINK1 was the best predictor of disease free survival in malignant adrenal cortex neoplasms.
HURP regulates Kif18A localization and dynamics at the plus end of kinetochore microtubules.
Hepatocellular carcinoma patients can be separated into three prognosis-distinguishable groups by use of a risk score that is based upon HURP expression.
DLGAP5-PINK1 and BUB1B-PINK1 were strong predictors of disease-free survival and overall survival, respectively, among adult patients with ACT.
Knockdown of HURP inhibits the proliferation of hepacellular carcinoma cells via downregulation of gankyrin and accumulation of p53.
HURP is a substrate of Aurora kinase A, which plays a crucial role in the stabilization of kinetochore fiber
RNA purification using functionalized MNPs was 97%. CONCLUSIONS: The developed colorimetric HURP RNA AuNP assay is sensitive, simple, and can aid noninvasive diagnosis of bladder cancer
The expression of DLGAP5 is regulated by methylation; the up-regulation of DLGAP5 contributes to hepatocellular carcinoma tumorigenesis by promoting cell proliferation.

expression of DLG7, a hypoxia-controlled gene, holds prognostic potential in high-risk CaP; this also demonstrates that variation of oxygen tension may constitute a tool for identification of novel biomarkers for CaP.
Detection of urinary HURP RNA is a useful for early detection of bladder cancer and bilharzial bladder cancer.
Aurora-A/HURP relays cell transforming signal to NF-kappaB, and the HURP/NF-kappaB complex is engaged in the regulation of cyclin E1 expression.
Data provide evidence for the involvement of HURP protein in the modulation of prostate cancer cell resistance to gamma irradiation via mechanism mediated by the ubiquitination of ATM and p53.
Elevated NEK2, DLGAP5 and ECT2 expression was negatively correlated with both overall survival (OS) and relapse-free survival (RFS).

The bioinformatic analysis suggests that HURP promotes carcinogenesis in multiple manners. Taken together, we revealed the prognostic value of HURP in nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC)patients and HURP may be a potential therapeutic target for NSCLC.
HURP recruits TACC3 to regulate K-fiber formation and support chromosome congression.
DLGAP5 has a unique function in stabilizing spindle formation and surviving microtubule assault from docetaxel, in an androgen-regulated cell cycle system.

Study provides evidence that downregulation of NUSAP1 can inhibit the proliferation, migration, and invasion of IBC cells by regulating CDK1 and DLGAP5 expression and enhances the drug susceptibility to E-ADM.
DLG7/DLGAP5 represents a potential biomarker for colorectal cancer.
positive expression of DLGAP5 in prostate cancer tissues correlates with poor prognosis of patients and has a role in castration-resistant prostate cancer cell growth and migration.
Spindle-Length-Dependent HURP Localization Allows Centrosomes to Control Kinetochore-Fiber Plus-End Dynamics.
The expression of hepatoma upregulated protein in human endometrium during the menstrual cycle.
Ran-GTP Is Non-essential to Activate NuMA for Mitotic Spindle-Pole Focusing but Dynamically Polarizes HURP Near Chromosomes.
Screening and identification of LMNB1 and DLGAP5, two key biomarkers in gliomas.
Pan-cancer analysis and experiments with cell lines reveal that the slightly elevated expression of DLGAP5 is involved in clear cell renal cell carcinoma progression.
Whole Genome Transcriptomic Analysis of Ovary Granulosa Cells Revealed an Anti-Apoptosis Regulatory Gene DLGAP5 in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.
DLGAP5 knockdown inactivates the Wnt/beta-catenin signal to repress endometrial cancer cell malignant activities.
High Expression of DLGAP5 Indicates Poor Prognosis and Immunotherapy in Lung Adenocarcinoma and Promotes Proliferation through Regulation of the Cell Cycle.
circ_0058063 promotes breast cancer progression by upregulating DLGAP5 via sponging miR-557.
DLGAP5 promotes gallbladder cancer migration and tumor-associated macrophage M2 polarization by activating cAMP.
DLGAP5 triggers proliferation and metastasis of bladder cancer by stabilizing E2F1 via USP11.
DLGAP5 promotes lung adenocarcinoma growth via upregulating PLK1 and serves as a therapeutic target.

BP.term: mitotic chromosome movement towards spindle pole
positive regulation of mitotic metaphase/anaphase transition

name: DLG associated protein 5
summary: Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including centrosome localization; kinetochore assembly; and mitotic spindle organization. Located in several cellular components, including centrosome; cytosol; and mitochondrion. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
